definitions.text: not moving quickly; taking a comparatively long time
examples: he was slow in reacting to the news
the band played a slow waltz

definitions.text: slow to learn or understand; lacking intellectual acuity; ; ; - Thackeray
examples: so dense he never understands anything I say to him
never met anyone quite so dim
although dull at classical learning, at mathematics he was uncommonly quick
dumb officials make some really dumb decisions
he was either normally stupid or being deliberately obtuse

definitions.text: (used of timepieces) indicating a time earlier than the correct time
so lacking in interest as to cause mental weariness; ; ; ; ; ; - Edmund Burke; ; - Mark Twain
examples: a boring evening with uninteresting people
the deadening effect of some routine tasks
a ho-hum speaker who couldn't capture their attention
what an irksome task the writing of long letters is
the tiresome chirping of a cricket
other people's dreams are dreadfully wearisome

definitions.text: without speed (`slow' is sometimes used informally for `slowly')
examples: go easy here--the road is slippery
please go slow so I can see the sights
the clock is almost an hour slow
